content:
I think the film's themes and message are incredibly powerful and timely. The way it explores female empowerment, agency, and community is so important, especially in today's society. The film shows that even in the darkest of times, women can come together, support each other, and find their own voices.

I think the film's message about the importance of listening to and believing women is crucial. It's a powerful indictment of patriarchal society and the ways in which women's voices have been silenced and dismissed throughout history. The film highlights the importance of creating spaces where women can speak freely and be heard.

One thing that resonated with me was the way the film portrayed the complexity of women's experiences. It didn't shy away from showing the flaws and doubts of the characters, and that made them feel so relatable and human. The film showed that women are not one-dimensional heroes or victims, but complex, multifaceted individuals with their own strengths and weaknesses.
